title: Odd stock issue to Chinese trust sparks microcap's surge
text:
Shareholders of Envirosuite, a microcap which has seen its stock price more than double since last month, are being offered shares at almost four times the price of an unusual share issue to the personal trust of a Chinese national just four weeks ago.

The $125 million ASX-listed company, which supplies software systems that track environmental pollutants in real-time, on Thursday requested its shares be placed in a trading halt in relation to a "proposed capital raise" but did not give further details.

Envirosuite chief executive Peter White and Beijing BHZQ general manager Zhigang Zhang at the contract signing. Envirosuite

In emails to investors, the company revealed it is seeking to raise $10 million at 28¢ a share via Bell Potter, with bids due by Thursday at 3pm.

The share placement comes less than four weeks after the company said it issued 50 million shares at 8¢ a share in two tranches to the personal vehicle of Zhigang Zhang, who is also the general manager of a listed water services company.

The deeply discounted share issue to the investing entity of Mr Zhang's family trust and his nominated entities is part of the agreement for a "strategically funded entry into the China market that the Board sees as potentially transformational".
description: A surging microcap is asking investors to buy shares at nearly four times the price it issued stock to the personal vehicle of a Chinese national just four weeks ago.
